content.description: This problem is better than it looks. The beginning involves surmounting the tip of a triangular shaped bulge in the rock.  Then pull a spooky smearing move to get to the pointy top of the whole boulder.
content.location: The leftmost problem on the two boulders. Look for the obvious triangular shaped hold a little over head height.

content.description: The namesake problem and perhaps the best boulder problem in county! It combines some crack and face climbing up a tall boulder with a good landing.  The movement is fantastic and the top out is really fun and not as scary as you'd think. The crux is probably transitioning from the crack to the face down low.
content.location: Start as low as you can manage in the crack to get the most out of the problem. This is currently the rightmost problem on the County Classic boulder.  Easy walkoff down the back of the boulder.

content.description: A fun variation to the corridor slab. Start with one hand on the arete at the end of the corridor and the other hand on a hold on the slab.  Climb left and around the protrusion of the other boulder and then join the normal corridor slab problem.
content.location: Starts in the back of the corridor on the left.

content.description: This problem climbs the slabby side of the boulder at the entrance to the corridor and shares a few top holds with the Pyramantle problem next door.
content.location: Just left of where the larger boulder looms over and creates a small corridor.

content.description: This problem looks good and has decent movement, but is somewhat unsatisfying when climbed, perhaps because it's still cleaning up.  It starts with a right hand on the good hold in the crack down low and the left hand on an edge on the face.  Move up and left using the crack and good footwork to gain the jug when the crack meets the top of the boulder. Then throw a leg up high on the right and mantle. It's best when the top of the boulder isn't used for handholds to the right of where the crack reaches the top.
content.location: On the right wall at the end of the corridor.

content.description: A great liebacking problem with a heady topout. There's an optional sit start with one handjam in the wide part of the bottom of the crack.
content.location: The obvious crack to the left of the County Classic problem.
